sen.j: 源氏が都を追われ、後見を失った末摘花の生活は困窮を極めていた。
sen.e: Genji was driven away from the capital, and Suetsumuhana, who lost her guardian, was left destitute.

sen.j: 邸は荒れ果てて召使たちも去り、受領の北の方となっている叔母が姫を娘の女房に迎えようとするが、末摘花は応じない。
sen.e: The residence fell into ruin, and her maids left, so her aunt, who was a wife of zuryo (the head of the provincial governors), tried to take in Suetsumuhana as her daughter's court lady, but she would not accept the offer.

sen.e: Before long, her aunt's husband became Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices), and she took jiju (a chamberlain) for menotogo (a child of a menoto, a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby), whom Suetsumuhana depended on.
